meanings.definition: To put in danger or at risk.
meanings.sent1: Leaving the door unlocked is imperiling our safety.
meanings.sent2: Not wearing a seatbelt can imperil your life in a car accident.
meanings.sent3: Forgetting to bring an umbrella on a rainy day imperils your dry clothes.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring warning signs is like imperiling yourself knowingly.
meanings.sent5: Swimming in deep waters without supervision imperils even strong swimmers.

meanings.sent1: His reckless driving imperiled the lives of other drivers on the road.
meanings.sent2: The economic crisis imperiled the future of many small businesses.
meanings.sent3: Eating spicy food before a big presentation can imperil your chances of success.
meanings.sent4: The villain's plan to detonate the bomb imperiled the entire city.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds imperiled the picnic plans with the threat of rain.
